page.title: 16Landscape
page.content: There are 4 main features in the area we studied. 1. The M23 motorway which is intersected by the A264 in the north west section of our area.2.The fishponds owned by the Chheesmuir family and Lady Lytton,these ar e stocked with carp,perch,mirror carp and crayfish.3.Crabbet Park Equestrian centre.This was originally a large mansion owned by the Lytton family but the land has been bought and used as an equestrian centre the mansion is boarded up and in total disrepair.The Riding Centre consists of stables, a large indoor centre,a residential block and class rooms.4. Burleys Wood, most of this has been cleared and the Crabbet housing estate has been built on it.These houses were built by Laing homes.They are Privately owned 3 bedroomed link detatched houses costingÂ£50,000.
